choices.text:
what is a Hendiadys?
A hendiadys (also known as the "two-for-one" construction) is a rhetorical device in which two words or phrases are used to express an idea, with the second element modifying or expanding upon the first. For example, "the great outdoors," where "great" and "outdoors" work together as a single concept, or "a picture is worth a thousand words," where "picture" and "words" are combined to create a more impactful statement.
